comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of October 18, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9502EFDC133FE633A... Has the headline: CARNEGIE COMES BACK.; Tells of His Talk with the Kaiser -- He'll Vote for Mitchel. and began "Andrew Carnegie returned yesterday from his annual Summer visit to Europe on the Cunard Liner Mauretania, accompanied by his wife and daughter, looking in the best of health." See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3490801625/ for the October 1912 equivalent.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq: Looks like this does match that October 1913 article.  Thanks.

comment.author: 31711899@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Clan Carnegie, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 48809099@N02
comment._content: My grandmother worked for the Carnegie family in their 5th Avenue home and returned to Scotland to work at Skibo Castle.
